edu.washington.escience.parallel

Class PartitionFunction<K,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.washington.escience.parallel.PartitionFunction<K,V>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public abstract class PartitionFunction<K,V>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The ShuffleProducer class uses an instance of the PartitionFunction class to decide which worker a tuple should be routed to. Typically, the ShuffleProducer class invokes partition on every tuple it generates.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getAttribute

      • partition

        public abstract int partition(TupleBatch t,
            Schema td)
        Given an input tuple t, determine which partition to route it to. Note: Schema td is explicitly required even though the Tuple t includes a Schema (obtained by calling t.getSchema()) since field names might be absent from t.getSchema(), and the PartitionFunction might require field names.
        Parameters:
        t - the input tuple to route.
        td - the tuple descriptor of the input tuple. Must have non-null names for those attributes that are used to compute the worker to route to.
        Returns:
        the worker to send the tuple to.
